title: US justice department claims Facebook unfairly overlooked American workers
text: A new lawsuit says the social media giant favored those with H1-B visas, ‘refusing' to recruit, consider or hire qualified US workers

title: Trump administration sues Facebook over alleged favoritism for immigrant workers
text: The Trump administration sued Facebook on Thursday for allegedly passing over US job candidates for thousands of positions in favor of immigrant workers holding temporary visas.

title: DOJ accuses Facebook of discriminating against US workers
text: The Justice Department accused Facebook on Thursday of discriminating against US workers, saying in a new lawsuit the social media giant has given hiring preferences to temporary workers, including those who hold H-1B visas. The Justice Department said that Facebook had “refused” to recruit, consider or hire qualified US workers for more than 2,600 jobs.

title: Justice Department is filing a lawsuit against Facebook for discriminating against U.S. workers
text: The DOJ is suing Facebook, claiming the company favored H1-B workers and other visa holders over U.S workers. CNBC's Ylan Mui.

title: Facebook accused by Trump administration of favoring H-1B workers
text: The Department of Justice files a lawsuit against Facebook, alleging discrimination against US workers.

title: DOJ sues Facebook for allegedly discriminating against US workers
text: Facebook faces a new lawsuit from the DOJ alleging it discriminated against U.S. workers by reserving positions for temporary visa holders.

title: Trump DOJ Sues Facebook For Allegedly Reserving Jobs For Immigrants Instead Of American Workers
text: The Trump administration has long sought to limit HB-1 visa holders at U.S. companies.

title: Justice Department accuses Facebook of discriminating against U.S. workers
text: The U.S. Justice Department accused Facebook of discriminating against U.S. workers on Thursday, saying in a new lawsuit the social media giant has given hiring preferences to temporary workers who hold H-1B visas.

title: Facebook could soon face antitrust lawsuit from 20 to 30 states
text: A group of 20 to 30 state attorneys general is reportedly readying a suit against the social-media giant.

title: Former FTC commissioner on U.S. plan to sue Facebook: It's highly unusual at this stage
text: CNBC's "Squawk Alley" team discusses the state attorneys general plan to file lawsuit against Facebook with Mozelle Thompson, former FTC commissioner.

title: States reportedly planning to file Facebook antitrust lawsuit next week
text: More than 40 US states are planning to bring an antitrust lawsuit against Facebook next week, a new report says. The coalition of states — led by New York — is preparing the suit as the social-media giant faces a similar probe by the Federal Trade Commission, Reuters reported Wednesday.

title: Facebook could face an antitrust lawsuit from at least 20 states as soon as next week
text: Multiple outlets have reported the Federal Trade Commission is likely to file its own antitrust lawsuit against the social media giant.

title: Facebook's Diem, Visa, and PayPal are looking to capitalize on the crypto payments space
text: Visa, PayPal, and Diem, formerly known as Libra, are looking to capitalize on the rapidly growing industry.

title: FB Stock Offers Early Buy Point, Nearing Breakout As Facebook Floats Diem Cryptocurrency Plan
text: Is FB stock a buy? The FANG stock is showing bullish action as it readies its Diem cryptocurrency, but antitrust concerns a post-Covid hangover are risks.
